p: Of the viruses discovered over the last 7 years, human metapneumovirus (HMPV) and the newly emerging human coronaviruses (HCoV) are considered causative agents of respiratory disease. However, to date, SARS coronavirus has been restricted geographically and has only been associated with limited and sporadic outbreaks. Recently, human bocavirus (HBoV) and the new human polyomaviruses KIV, WUV and Merkel Cell polyomavirus (MCV) were detected in respiratory secretions, and although an association with the respiratory tract has been postulated, it still remains to be proven [ 2, 8, 16].
